thread.title: Peter Miracle Baby Announces He's Now Pastor, Vows to Walk with God: "Hakuna Kurudi Nyuma" - Tuko.co.ke
thread.title_full: Peter Miracle Baby Announces He's Now Pastor, Vows to Walk with God: "Hakuna Kurudi Nyuma" - Tuko.co.ke

author: Brian Ajon
title: Peter Miracle Baby Announces He's Now Pastor, Vows to Walk with God: "Hakuna Kurudi Nyuma" - Tuko.co.ke
text: Peter Miracle Baby Announces He's Now Pastor, Vows to Walk with God: "Hakuna Kurudi Nyuma" - Reformed Gengetone artiste Peter Miracle Baby has been anointed as a servant of God - The young man shared his new path on social media with several photos from the church ceremony - Peter thanked Apostle John Paul for officially making him a pastor and invited followers to join him for a live sermon Former Sailors Gang member Peter Miracle Baby has begun a new chapter in his life. The young man received anointing to become a pastor on Sunday, June 2. Peter Miracle Baby's receives Christ The musician took to social media to announce this new journey and shared photos of him in church alongside his spiritual father John Paul. PAY ATTENTION: Share your outstanding story with our editors! Please reach us through news@tuko.co.ke or WhatsApp: 0732482690. Miracle Baby also vowed to serve the Almighty God without backsliding. "Thank you Apostle John Paul for making me pastor officially Now nikumtumikia mungu Bila kurudi nyuma kama kawaida Leo Tupatane live from 6pm-7pm tuskie NENO PAMOJA," he wrote. How Miracle Baby was welcomed from hospital About two months ago, Miracle Baby was discharged from the hospital after his plea from Kenyans to help him raise money to pay treatment bills. Miracle Baby had been in the hospital for 60 days after undergoing three successful surgeries but could not leave until he paid his medical fees. However, in a new video shared on TikTok by @mburu_makeup, the musician could be seen in high spirits as he walked around his house meeting people. He wore a loose hospital shirt and tiny shorts that covered the catheter he was wearing, and he said hello to people who were excited to welcome him back home. The house was also covered with huge white and golden balloons with one written "Welcome home Peter" shared on the wall. William Ruto donates KSh 300k to Miracle Baby As we previously told you, President William Ruto sent Jaguar, Karangu Muraya and other local artistes to deliver his KSh 300,000 to Miracle Baby. According to Muraya, Ruto also directed that he be taken to the hospital and that his medical bills be paid . While sharing the funds, they also passed the president's warm message. Source: TUKO.co.ke []https://www.tuko.co.ke/authors/brian-ajon/ Brian Ajon (Entertainment Editor) Brian Ajon is a journalist accredited by The Media Council of Kenya with close to three years of experience in print and digital media. At Tuko.co.ke, he is an Entertainment Editor (joined in 2021). He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Communication and Media Technology with IT from Maseno University. Ajon is also the Newsletter Editor of the Maseno University Alumni Association (MSU-AA) and He is keen on entertainment and viral stories. Email: brian.ajon@tuko.co.ke.
